That social experiment may sound good on paper, but, wait a minute, the whole point of the show is that it's not supposed to be scripted.

And even if the show isn't scripted, I've always had a problem buying the premise that anything in this or any other reality show is real.

The contestants may have to rub two sticks together to make fire, but don't think for a minute that they're in any real danger, surrounded by a camera crew complete with portable soundstage and generators.
Unless, of course, the TV lights accidentally set the whole island on fire.
Like I said, if you weren't planning on watching this social experiment, don't let me stop you.
But if you want to see a real reality show, with people of all colors stuck in a truly desperate situation with not much more than the clothes on their backs, do turn on the TV.
